content:
SecurityContextSecurityToken Class

Definition

Represents the token defined by the WS-SecureConversation specification.

In this Article

public class SecurityContextSecurityToken : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken, IDisposable
Inheritance
Object
System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken
SecurityContextSecurityToken

Inherited Members

ResolveKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)
Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

An instance of this class contains key material along with authentication information that represents the client. The user selects the particular cryptographic algorithm to use with it.

Constructors

Initializes a new instance of the SecurityContextSecurityToken class.

public SecurityContextSecurityToken (System.Xml.UniqueId contextId, byte[] key, DateTime validFrom, DateTime validTo);

UniqueId

key
Byte[]

A byte array that represents the key.

validFrom
DateTime

The effective start time.

validTo
DateTime

The expiration time.

Remarks

The contextId should be unique among all security context tokens issued by the service.

Properties

AuthorizationPolicies

Gets a read-only collection of token authorization policies.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy> AuthorizationPolicies { get; }
Value
ReadOnlyCollection<IAuthorizationPolicy>

A read-only collection of IAuthorizationPolicy instances.

Gets or sets the SecurityMessageProperty extracted from the bootstrap message.

public System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty BootstrapMessageProperty { get; set; }
Value
SecurityMessageProperty

A security message property.

ContextId

Gets the context id.

public System.Xml.UniqueId ContextId { get; }
Value
UniqueId

A UniqueId that represents the context id.

Id

Gets the token id.

public override string Id { get; }
Value
String

The token id.

IsCookieMode

Gets a value that indicates whether a security context token (SCT) with a mode setting that specifies how cookies are handled is read in.

public bool IsCookieMode { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if a cookie mode SCT is read in; otherwise, false.

KeyEffectiveTime

Gets the key effective start time.

public DateTime KeyEffectiveTime { get; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime that represents the key effective start time.

KeyExpirationTime

Gets the key expiration time.

public DateTime KeyExpirationTime { get; }
Value
DateTime

A DateTime that represents the key expiration time.

KeyGeneration

Gets the key generation.

public System.Xml.UniqueId KeyGeneration { get; }
Value
UniqueId

A UniqueId that represents the key generation.

Remarks

Starting with the .NET Framework 3.5, this property is emitted on the wire as an <sc:Instance> element. In prior versions of the .NET Framework, it was emitted as an <sc:Generation> element.

Gets a read-only collection of security keys.

public override System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey> SecurityKeys { get; }

ReadOnlyCollection<SecurityKey>

DateTime

A DateTime that represents the token effective start time.

ValidTo

CreateKeyIdentifierClause<T>()

Creates a key identifier clause of a specified type.

public override T CreateKeyIdentifierClause<T> () where T : System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause;
Returns
T

A SecurityKeyIdentifierClause cast to type T.

Dispose()

Releases unmanaged resources used by this instance of this object.

public void Dispose ();

Remarks

Use this method to close or release unmanaged resources, such as files, streams, and handles held by an instance of the class that implements this interface. This method is, by convention, used for all tasks associated with freeing resources held by an object, or preparing an object for reuse.

For more information, see Dispose.

MatchesKeyIdentifierClause(SecurityKeyIdentifierClause)

Indicates whether the current token's key identifier clause matches a specified key identifier clause.

public override bool MatchesKeyIdentifierClause (System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause keyIdentifierClause);
keyIdentifierClause
SecurityKeyIdentifierClause

The specified key identifier clause.

Returns
Boolean

true if the current token's key identifier clause matches a specified key identifier clause; otherwise, false. The default is false.

String

A text representation of the current instance of this object.
